pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:0.5: 21. The training rule on the instruction
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.2: At that time the senior monks who were instructing the nuns received robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicines.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.3: When the monks from the group of six found out about this,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.5: they thought, “Well then, let’s instruct the nuns.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.6: They then went to the nuns and said, “Come to us, Sisters, and we too will instruct you.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.7: Soon afterwards those nuns went to the monks from the group of six,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.9: But after giving just a short teaching, those monks spent the day on pointless talk. They then dismissed the nuns, saying, “Go, Sisters.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.10: Those nuns then went to the Buddha and bowed, and the Buddha said to them, “Nuns, I hope the instruction was effective?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.11: “Venerable Sir, how could the instruction be effective?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.12: After giving just a short teaching, the monks from the group of six spent the day on pointless talk, and then dismissed us.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.13: The Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened those nuns with a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.14: The nuns bowed, circumambulated the Buddha with their right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.15: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks from the group of six:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.16: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.19: “Foolish men, how can you give just a short teaching to the nuns, and then spend the day on pointless talk, before dismissing them?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.20: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.22: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.23: “Monks, you should appoint an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.24: And this is how he should be appointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.25: First a monk should be asked
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.26: and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.27: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.28: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, it should appoint monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.30: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.31: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.32: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.33: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.34: For the second time I speak on this matter: …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.35: For the third time I speak on this matter:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.36: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.37: The Sangha appoints monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.38: Any monk who approves of appointing monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns should remain silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.39: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.40: The Sangha has appointed monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.41: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.42: Then, after rebuking the monks from the group of six in many ways for being difficult to support …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.43: the Buddha said, “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.44.1: ‘If a monk who has not been agreed upon instructs the nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:1.45: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.1: After being appointed to do so, the senior monks who instructed the nuns still received robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicines.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.2: When they found out about this, the monks from the group of six said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.4: “Well then, let’s go outside the monastic boundary, appoint each other as instructors of the nuns, and then instruct them.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.5: After doing just that, they again went to the nuns and said, “Sisters, we too have been appointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.6: Come to us, and we too will instruct you.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.7: Once again the nuns went to the monks from the group of six and everything unfolded as before.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.18: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks from the group of six:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.19: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.22: “Foolish men, how can you give just a short teaching to the nuns, and then spend the day on pointless talk, before dismissing them?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.23: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …”…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.25: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.26: “Monks, you should appoint a monk who possesses eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.27: He is virtuous and restrained by the Monastic Code. His conduct is good, he associates with the right people, and he sees danger in minor faults. And he undertakes and trains in the training rules.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.28: He has learned much, and he retains and accumulates what he has learned. Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, that have a true goal and are well articulated, and that set out the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—he has learned many such teachings, retained them in mind, recited them verbally, mentally investigated them, and penetrated them well by view.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.29: He has properly learned both Monastic Codes in detail; he has well analyzed them, thoroughly mastered them, and well investigated them, both in terms of the rules and their detailed exposition.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.30: He is well-spoken and has a good voice.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.31: He is generally liked by and pleasing to the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.32: He is capable of instructing the nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.33: He has never committed a heavy offense against a Buddhist nun.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.34: He has been fully ordained for at least twenty years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:2.35: Monks, you should appoint a monk who possesses these eight qualities as an instructor of the nuns.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.5: Who has not been agreed upon:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.6: who has not been agreed upon through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.8: they have been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.10: If he instructs in the eight important principles, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.11: If he instructs in any other teaching, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.12: If he instructs a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.13: The monk who has been agreed upon should sweep the precincts, set out water for drinking and water for washing, prepare a seat, get hold of a companion, and then sit down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.14: The nuns should go there, bow down to the monk, and sit down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.15: The monk should then ask them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.17: If they say, “We’re all present, Venerable,” he should say, “Are you keeping the eight important principles?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.18: If they say, “We are,” he should present the instruction, “This is the instruction.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.19: If they say, “We’re not,” he should recite the important principles:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.20: “A nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should bow down to a monk who was given the full ordination on that very day, and she should stand up for him, raise her joined palms to him, and do acts of respect toward him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.21: This rule is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.22: A nun should not spend the rainy season in a monastery without monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.23: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.24: Every half-month a nun should ask the Sangha of monks for two things:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.25: about the date of the observance day and about going for the instruction.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.26: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.27: A nun who has completed the rainy-season residence should invite correction from both Sanghas in regard to three things:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.28: what has been seen, what has been heard, and what has been suspected.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.29: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.30: A nun who has committed a heavy offense should undertake a trial period toward both Sanghas for a half-month.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.31: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.32: A trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years may seek for full ordination in both Sanghas.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.33: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.34: A nun may not in any way abuse or revile a monk.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.35: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.36: From today onwards, nuns may not correct monks, but monks may correct nuns.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.37: This rule too is to be honored and respected all one’s life, and is not to be breached.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.38: If they say, “We’re all present, Venerable,” and he instructs them with another teaching, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.39: If they say, “We’re not all present, Venerable,” and he instructs them in the eight important principles, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc21:3.1.40: If he does not present the instruction, but he gives them another teaching, then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
